p: The fourth study site was the Lake Alaotra region in Madagascar ( Figure 3). Madagascar is an Indian Ocean island lying 400 km off the eastern coast of southern Africa. Located 750 m above sea level, the Lake Alaotra region constitutes the largest wetland area in Madagascar, and is a rich habitat for wild birds [31]. It is the largest rice production basin in the country and also is the site of important poultry production activities. There are small-scale chicken farms and ducks and geese are allowed to graze on rice paddies. The following five municipalities located on the lakeside were included in the study: Andromba, Imerimandroso, Ampitatsimo, Anororo, and Amparafaravola.
